ua.net.freecode.chart
Class ChartPosition

java.lang.Object
  ua.net.freecode.chart.ChartPosition
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class ChartPosition
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Many items to be placed on the chart require x,y coordinates to place them. We made a flexible system, so that you can use either absolute or relative coordinates, which are relative with respect to top, bottom, left, right, center of the main chart or top, bottom, left, right, center of the chartâ€™s data area and can be expressed either in pixels or in percent to the whole chart length (width or height). ChartPosition encapsulates this functionality.

See Also:

Constructor Detail

ChartPosition

public ChartPosition(int x,
                     ChartPosition.OriginX originX,
                     ChartPosition.Units unitX,
                     int y,
                     ChartPosition.OriginY originY,
                     ChartPosition.Units unitY)
Sets the position on the chart, which can be either in absolute coordinates or relative to chart sides or to the main data area of the chart.

Parameters:
x - the value of x
originX - the origin for x value
unitX - pixels or percents for x value
y - the value of y
originY - the origin for y value
unitY - pixels or percents for y value
